extendedIngredients.name: trout fillet
extendedIngredients.original: 10 ounces smoked trout fillet, skin and bones removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: smoked trout fillet, skin and bones removed

title: Smoked Trout "Pâté"
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Smoked Trout "Pâté" a try. This recipe serves 2 and costs $4.27 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 33g of protein, 27g of fat, and a total of 396 calories. This recipe from Serious Eats has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up trout fillet, rye crackers, cream cheese, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the rye meal you could follow this main course with the Wide-Eyed Owl Cupcakes as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 65%. This score is solid. Try Smoked Trout Pate, Smoked Trout Pâté, and Smoked-trout Pate for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Mash the fillets with the cream cheese and lemon juice.  Season to taste (the trout will already be somewhat salty).                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Add a pinch of cayenne, if desired and to taste.  Serve on crackers or toast.

steps.step: Mash the fillets with the cream cheese and lemon juice.  Season to taste (the trout will already be somewhat salty).
Add a pinch of cayenne, if desired and to taste.
